Board module¶

class Board.Board¶

Bases: object

Class for creating components of active player and opponent game boards and changing or checking the characteristics of the boards and displaying them.

checkShipOverlap(x, y, len, orient)¶
createShip(startx, starty, orient, length, shipnumber)¶

Creates a ship object to place on a game board.

Parameters

  • startx (int) – the column index in 2D array for start position for placing a ship

  • starty (int) – the row index in a 2D array for start position for placing a ship

  • orient (string) – the orientation from the start position for building a ship

  • length (int) – the size of a ship

  • shipnumber (int) – the number label used as a symbol to indicate a ship

hit(y, x)¶

Determines whether entered coordinates hit a ship, and gives feedback on whether ship is hit and if a ship is sunk.

Parameters

  • y (int) – the row for the shot location

  • x (int) – the column for the shot location

isShipValid(orient, startx, starty, length)¶
printBoard()¶

Prints the active player’s game board with a border to mark coordinates (A-J for columns and 1-9 for rows). The printed board shows all the ships because it uses the waterGrid 2D array for printing data.

printOpp()¶

Prints the opponent player’s game board with a border to mark coordinates (A-J for columns and 1-9 for rows). The printed board hides all the ships because it uses the oppGrid 2D array for printing data.

score(opp)¶

Keeps track of the ships remaining for each player, and determines when all ships are sunk for a player, and which player won

Parameters

opp (a Board object) – the opponent’s Board object, so it can be compared to self
